result.execSummary:
The defendant Corbett G. Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[JK] case called at 2:48pm
Defendant Corbett G. Ross appears via videoconferencing, from Fox Lake Correctional Institution, in custody. Assistant Attorney General Chris Liegel appears in court for the State.
On agreement of the parties, the Court finds the video conferencing system to be sight and sound sufficient.
The Court indicates that he mailed a notice on Jan 11th to Attorney Ksicinksi and has not received a response. Upon questioning of the Court, Mr Ross indicates that he has not spoken with him either.
Mr. Ross makes a statement about his many efforts to communicate with Attorney Ksicniski; he has not received any response or communication from Attorney Ksicniski. 

The Court addresses the 2/9/17 Petition, filed by Mr. Ross, to Refund Forfeited Cash Bond.
--arguments are given by AAG Liegel, by Mr. Ross
--the Court notes that there has not been any assertion made that the Court failed to follow the statutory procedure related to bail forfeiture
--the Court explains to Mr. Ross that there is no basis for the Court to take any new action on the forfeited cash bond.

The Court addresses the request of Mr. Ross to receive credit for time spent in a treatment center and in the Winnebago County Jail in Illinois:
--AAG Liegel reviews the dates that Mr. Ross provided in the request, and indicates that the State's position is that Mr. Ross is entitled to 5 additional days credit.
--The Court orders 5 additional days credit for the dates of January 16, 2015 through January 21, 2015.
--after hearing arguments on Mr Ross' request that he be given days credit for the time he spent in a treatment program, the Court finds that Mr. Ross is not entitled to any such credit because the Court did not order Mr. Ross to be in treatment.
recess: 3:03pm

NEXT:  Amended of the JOC to add five days credit for time already served

Stipulation regarding plea

Cases 15CF28, 15CF40 & 15CF88 called together at 10:44 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Corbett G. Ross in court with Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski. Assistant Attorney General Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Ksicinski submits stipulation and order with all parties signature - informs Court is exact same as previously submitted, just includes AAGs signature
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Statement by Nathaniel Ross; Statement by Stephanie Happ; Statement by Gregory Ross

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1, #2 & #3-15CF40, Count #1-15CF28 & Count #1-15CF88; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 - #6-15CF88

15CF40-Counts #1, #2 & #3: Court sentences Mr. Ross to 16 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 8 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 8 years, each count, concurrent. This sentence is to commence forthwith and concurrent to 15CF28 & 15CF88

15CF28-Court sentences Mr. Ross to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years, each count, concurrent. This sentence is to commence concurrent to 15CF40 & 15CF88

15CF88-On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Ross to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years, each count, concurrent. This sentence is to commence concurrent to 15CF40 & 15CF28

On Motion of the State, the Court reads into the record, an uncharged referral one count of possession of stolen property, based on Defendant Ross's pawning of stolen television sets in Dane County on 12/30/14 - investigation by Lake Mills PD - pawned about 150 televisions. Those items were stolen from Lake Mills and pawned in Dane County. Televisions have been recovered & identified. 
Atty Ksicinski confirms for the Court that they are aware that AAG Gabrysiak is offering no guarantee of immunity in Dane County.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program on or after 3/1/2019 on each count. 
The Court gives 194 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision for all cases:
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--To pay mandatory DNA Surcharge 
--To pay restitution of $283.50, payable to Stop-N-Go, Nickolas Vance, Manager (Count #1-15CF40)
--To pay restitution of $511.98, payable to Shell Gas, Shelly Jolliffe, Owner (Count #3-15CF40)
--To pay restitution of $609, payable to KP Mart, Kulpip Pangli, Owner (Count #2-15CF40)
--Court authorizes DOC to deduct restitution from prison wages not to exceed 25% of the inmates account
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
 except as necessary for employment and as approved by Agent
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
 or illegal drugs
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--Maintain full, continuous, employment of a type commensurate with skills and abilities which may be combined with an education program
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

Cases #15CF28 and #15CF40 called at 8:39[MO]
Defendant Corbett G. Ross in court, in custody,  with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  Special Prosecutor Jeffrey Gabrysiak appears for the State of Wisconsin.
As to both cases, Mr. Ross waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The State has filed with the Court the Informations. 

Arraignment held on both cases:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Atty. Gabrysiak informs the Court that the parties have agreed that Mr. Ross is to sign a new bond with a neutral witness, since Atty. De La Rosa had served as witness for the previously signed signature bond. 
Recess: 8:43am
[Post Hearing, Off Record: The Court clarifies to the Clerk that, as to Case #15CF40, the $10,000 cash bond and its requirements are now in effect. Until that amount is posted there is no need for witnessing of the bond]

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/18/2015 at 10:00am(Counsel will mutually agree to location for the Pre Trial Conference)     (2) Status Conference on 4/9/2015 at 8:30am
Duplicate original warrant returned//def in custody
The defendant is no longer in Hope Haven treatment program, the cash bond order now applies.
AMENDED

Case called at 10:03 am [Clerk SH] (On cont. Motion to Modify bond)
Defendant Corbett G. Ross appears via telephone, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa, who is in Court. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin, along with Assistant Attorney General, Gabrysiak.
Atty De La Rosa provides information update re: St. Clair's treatment program 
ADA Hall: Appropriate to make oral modifications to motion, presents basis

Court requires that if Defendant leaves St. Clair's or Hope Haven, then bond will revert to $10,000 cash bond, with conditions:

Court grants motion to modify bond, and converts the signature bond to a $10,000 cash bond, with all special conditions previously imposed to remain unchanged (which include).
--absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of needles and or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--take all medications only as prescribed
--no presence at the Stop N Go in Fort Atkinson, KP Mart in Fort Atkinson or the Shell Station at 423 S. Church St. in Watertown
--no contact with Christopher Kaat, Kuldip Pangli or Donald Duesterbeck
--no possession of weapons as defined by Wis. statute 939.22(10)
--no acts or threats of violence
--daily urinalysis at JCSD by 4pm starting 1/22/2015.  Test to include for opiates, marijuana and alcohol at least.
--perform assessment through JCHSD or other licensed therapist and comply with treatment recommendation. The Defendant is ordered to contact treatment facility to make appt. by 1/23/15 and to complete assessment by 1/26/15 unless further extention received from the Court.

The Court suspends imposition of the $10,000 cash bail requirement as long as the Defendant remains in the Hope Haven residential treatment facility in Madison and orders additional conditions of bond to be added to signature bond, with all other previously imposed conditions to remain the same: 
--If the Defendant leaves the Hope Haven Facility or its grounds, he is to notify the Clerk of Courts Office immediately
--Defendant to remain at Hope Haven treatment facility in Madison & provide that address to the Clerk of Courts within 48 hours
--Execute by noon tomorrow (2/11/15) a release authorizing the Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept., Jefferson County DAs Office or other law enforcement agency to be provided with information concerning whether the Defendant is at Hope Haven residential facility, and release may be limited to those facts. 
--Sign bond by noon tomorrow (2/11/15) 

Court informs parties that if It is notified that the Defendant has left Hope Haven, would be inclined to issue a warrant and the $10,000 bond will then be in effect.
Court directs COC to provide the original bond document to Attorney De La Rosa for administration
Atty De La Rosa requests that Hope Haven address be added to case-Court directs that information be provided and added to case, but not to replace residential address
Recess: 10:22 am 

NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing to be conducted via video or phone whether contested or not - **arrangements to be made-Defendant at Hope Haven**
Copy of Fax sent to Sgt. Brost
Motion hearing on February 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 11:55 [MO & MK]
Defendant Corbett G. Ross does not appear.  Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears for the Defense (PD has not appointed a specific attorney yet) . ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa reports that Mr. Ross is in an inpatient rehabilitation facility. Atty. De La Rosa notes that the wording on the notice of hearing does not specify that this is a mandatory appearance.
ADA Hall indicates that if the Defense can provide verification that Mr. Ross is in the inpatient rehabilitation facility, then the State will consider modifying its Motion to require the cash bond amount at the point when Mr. Ross is no longer in an inpatient facility--if he would leave for any reason, including removal from the program. 

The Court and counsel discuss scheduling, and the Court's intent that Mr. Ross either be in the facility or subject to a higher cash bail.  Attorney De La Rosa reports on his telephone contacts with the facility.  
The Court adjourns the Motion Hearing, indicating to Attorney De La Rosa that the Court will expect the Defense to provide verification that Mr. Ross remains at the facility as of the next hearing date. 
Recess: 12:02pm

NEXT: Adjourned Motion Hearing (on the State's Motion to Modify Bond) on 2/10/2015 at 10:00am; if the Defense provides verification that Mr. Ross is in the rehabilitation facility, then Mr. Ross may appear by telephone at the hearing
